Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and has enough water.
The student can draw a plant that lacks water and shows signs of wilting or drying.
The student can include patterns of how plants look with and without water.
The student can show that plants need water to grow and live.
The student can illustrate the difference between a well-watered plant and one that is not watered.
